one_reviews_text: To me Felix&Paul studios have created the most memorable and impressive VR experiences thus far and I love all their productions. Gymnasia is again impressive, although on another scale compared to Marshall or Miyubi. It’s a very sweet and a bit creepy stopmotion movie where you have to think of the work of Quay (more so then Svankmajer). Only complaint you could have that it is too short and it leaves you with a desire for more. Very recommended!

hi developers,  it's not working using Oculus Link + Quest  :(
Will change my review if I'm wrong or if this gets fixed!
pretty cool vr xp like its free ;)

I saw this and I thought why not, I think I only paid about £4. Really great short cinematic experience. The graphics were amazing, seemed like photo realistic and the atmosphere was great, I felt really scared whilst watching. 

I'm really glad I bought this short experience and will show this to all my friends. This is definitely a good experience to show what VR can produce other then games.
It's well done, but if you sell an "app" that is a video tell us how long it is. This is 5 - 6 minutes long.
review_feedback: Hi Neil, thank you for the feedback. We have updated the Oculus Store description with the runtime for the experience.

one_reviews_text: Please get back to us and explain why the headset is able the control a dot. ?The controllers has no affect. Can't press play to begin.
review_feedback: Hi Brian, thanks for reaching out. You can select "Play" with your gaze by looking at the play button until the cursor is over the text, and then pressing A on the Rift S controller. If this isn't working, please send an email to QA@felixandpaul.com and we will be able to help further!

one_reviews_text: I enjoyed it. Kinda tripped me out a bit. But it was way to short.
